main_definition: to convey, carry or introduce something from one place to another.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To cause someone or something to arrive at a particular time or location. Example: The rain brings cold weather in the springtime.
meanings_and_examples.example: The early morning sun always seems to bring warmth and light.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To be responsible for delivering an item, message, or result. Example: She was brought a cup of tea by her friend when she visited her house.
meanings_and_examples.example: I will bring the report on Friday as promised.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To provide or supply something that is needed or desired. Example: Good customer service can often be found in businesses that value bringing satisfaction to their customers.
meanings_and_examples.example: The chef brings a variety of fresh ingredients for each dish.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used when talking about something happening as a result or consequence. Example: Losing weight can bring many health benefits.
meanings_and_examples.example: Winning the game will surely bring pride to our team.
